alert.note: Alert for Mendocino Coast; Northern Humboldt Coast; Southeastern Mendocino Interior; Southern Humboldt Interior; Southwestern Humboldt; Southwestern Mendocino Interior (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued April 09 at 3:00PM PDT until April 09 at 10:00PM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PDT THIS EVENING... ...FROST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 9 AM PDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Frost Advisory, temperatures as low as 29 will result in frost formation. For the Wind Advisory, northwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts to around 45 mph. * WHERE...Northern Humboldt Coast, Southwestern Humboldt, Southern Humboldt Interior, Mendocino Coast, Southwestern Mendocino Interior and Southeastern Mendocino Interior Counties. * WHEN...For the Frost Advisory, from 1 AM to 9 AM PDT Sunday. For the Wind Advisory, until 10 PM PDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost could kill sensitive outdoor vegetation if left uncovered.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. Frost Advisories and Freeze Warnings are issued during the local growing season as defined by climatology and local agriculture experts. Once the growing season has ended these statements will no longer be issued until the spring.
